purpose_text.para: Provides controls for traps of execution of System instructions.

reg_groups.reg_group: A group mapping that does not have a known primary

field_description.para: Reserved, RES0.
Trap execution of multiple System instructions. Enables a trap on execution at EL1 and EL0 using AArch64 of any of the following AArch64 System instructions to EL2:

listitem.content: DC CGDVAC, if ARMv8.5-MemTag is implemented.
DC CGVAC, if ARMv8.5-MemTag is implemented.
DC CVAC.

field_value_description.para: Execution of the System instructions listed above is not affected by this bit.

If EL2 is implemented and enabled in the current Security state, HCR_EL2.{E2H,TGE} != {1,1}, and either EL3 is not implemented or SCR_EL3.FGTEn == 1, execution at EL1 and EL0 using AArch64 of any of the System instructions listed above is trapped to EL2 and reported with EC syndrome value 0x18, unless the instruction generates a higher priority exception.

field_description.para: Trap execution of SVC at EL1 using AArch64 to EL2.

field_value_description.para: Execution of SVC is not affected by this bit.

If EL2 is implemented and enabled in the current Security state and either EL3 is not implemented or SCR_EL3.FGTEn == 1, execution of SVC at EL1 using AArch64 is trapped to EL2 and reported with EC syndrome value 0x15, unless the instruction generates a higher priority exception.

field_description.para: Trap execution of SVC at EL0 using AArch64 and execution of SVC at EL0 using AArch32 when EL1 is using AArch64 to EL2.

field_value_description.para: Execution of SVC at EL0 using AArch64 and execution of SVC at EL0 using AArch32 is not affected by this bit.

If EL2 is implemented and enabled in the current Security state, HCR_EL2.{E2H,TGE} != {1,1}, EL1 is using AArch64, and either EL3 is not implemented or SCR_EL3.FGTEn == 1, then, unless the instruction generates a higher priority exception:

listitem.content: Execution of SVC at EL0 using AArch64 is trapped to EL2 and reported with EC syndrome value 0x15.
Execution of SVC at EL0 using AArch32 is trapped to EL2 and reported with EC syndrome value 0x11.

field_description.para: Trap execution of multiple System instructions. Enables a trap on execution at EL1 using AArch64 of any of the following AArch64 System instructions to EL2:

listitem.content: ERET.
ERETAA, if ARMv8.3-PAuth is implemented.
ERETAB, if ARMv8.3-PAuth is implemented.

field_value_description.para: Execution of the System instructions listed above is not affected by this bit.

If EL2 is implemented and enabled in the current Security state and either EL3 is not implemented or SCR_EL3.FGTEn == 1, execution at EL1 using AArch64 of any of the System instructions listed above is trapped to EL2 and reported with EC syndrome value 0x1A, unless the instruction generates a higher priority exception.

field_description.para: Trap execution of CPP RCTX at EL1 and EL0 using AArch64 and execution of CPPRCTX at EL0 using AArch32 when EL1 is using AArch64 to EL2.

field_value_description.para: Execution of CPP RCTX at EL1 and EL0 using AArch64 and execution of CPPRCTX at EL0 using AArch32 is not affected by this bit.

If EL2 is implemented and enabled in the current Security state, HCR_EL2.{E2H,TGE} != {1,1}, EL1 is using AArch64, and either EL3 is not implemented or SCR_EL3.FGTEn == 1, then, unless the instruction generates a higher priority exception:

listitem.content: Execution of CPP RCTX at EL1 and EL0 using AArch64 is trapped to EL2 and reported with EC syndrome value 0x18.
Execution of CPPRCTX at EL0 using AArch32 is trapped to EL2 and reported with EC syndrome value 0x03.

field_description.para: Reserved, RES0.
Trap execution of DVP RCTX at EL1 and EL0 using AArch64 and execution of DVPRCTX at EL0 using AArch32 when EL1 is using AArch64 to EL2.

field_value_description.para: Execution of DVP RCTX at EL1 and EL0 using AArch64 and execution of DVPRCTX at EL0 using AArch32 is not affected by this bit.

If EL2 is implemented and enabled in the current Security state, HCR_EL2.{E2H,TGE} != {1,1}, EL1 is using AArch64, and either EL3 is not implemented or SCR_EL3.FGTEn == 1, then, unless the instruction generates a higher priority exception:

listitem.content: Execution of DVP RCTX at EL1 and EL0 using AArch64 is trapped to EL2 and reported with EC syndrome value 0x18.
Execution of DVPRCTX at EL0 using AArch32 is trapped to EL2 and reported with EC syndrome value 0x03.

field_description.para: Reserved, RES0.
Trap execution of CFP RCTX at EL1 and EL0 using AArch64 and execution of CFPRCTX at EL0 using AArch32 when EL1 is using AArch64 to EL2.

field_value_description.para: Execution of CFP RCTX at EL1 and EL0 using AArch64 and execution of CFPRCTX at EL0 using AArch32 is not affected by this bit.

If EL2 is implemented and enabled in the current Security state, HCR_EL2.{E2H,TGE} != {1,1}, EL1 is using AArch64, and either EL3 is not implemented or SCR_EL3.FGTEn == 1, then, unless the instruction generates a higher priority exception:

listitem.content: Execution of CFP RCTX at EL1 and EL0 using AArch64 is trapped to EL2 and reported with EC syndrome value 0x18.
Execution of CFPRCTX at EL0 using AArch32 is trapped to EL2 and reported with EC syndrome value 0x03.

field_description.para: Reserved, RES0.
Trap execution of TLBI VAALE1 at EL1 using AArch64 to EL2.

field_value_description.para: Execution of TLBI VAALE1 is not affected by this bit.

If EL2 is implemented and enabled in the current Security state and either EL3 is not implemented or SCR_EL3.FGTEn == 1, execution of TLBI VAALE1 at EL1 using AArch64 is trapped to EL2 and reported with EC syndrome value 0x18, unless the instruction generates a higher priority exception.

field_description.para: Trap execution of multiple System instructions. Enables a trap on execution at EL1 and EL0 using AArch64 of any of the following AArch64 System instructions to EL2:

listitem.content: DC GVA, if ARMv8.5-MemTag is implemented.
DC GZVA, if ARMv8.5-MemTag is implemented.
DC ZVA.

field_value_description.para: Execution of the System instructions listed above is not affected by this bit.

If EL2 is implemented and enabled in the current Security state, HCR_EL2.{E2H,TGE} != {1,1}, and either EL3 is not implemented or SCR_EL3.FGTEn == 1, execution at EL1 and EL0 using AArch64 of any of the System instructions listed above is trapped to EL2 and reported with EC syndrome value 0x18, unless the instruction generates a higher priority exception.

field_description.para: Trap execution of IC IVAU at EL1 and EL0 using AArch64 to EL2.

field_value_description.para: Execution of IC IVAU is not affected by this bit.

If EL2 is implemented and enabled in the current Security state, HCR_EL2.{E2H,TGE} != {1,1}, and either EL3 is not implemented or SCR_EL3.FGTEn == 1, execution of IC IVAU at EL1 and EL0 using AArch64 is trapped to EL2 and reported with EC syndrome value 0x18, unless the instruction generates a higher priority exception.

field_description.para: Trap execution of IC IALLU at EL1 using AArch64 to EL2.

field_value_description.para: Execution of IC IALLU is not affected by this bit.

If EL2 is implemented and enabled in the current Security state and either EL3 is not implemented or SCR_EL3.FGTEn == 1, execution of IC IALLU at EL1 using AArch64 is trapped to EL2 and reported with EC syndrome value 0x18, unless the instruction generates a higher priority exception.

field_description.para: Trap execution of IC IALLUIS at EL1 using AArch64 to EL2.

field_value_description.para: Execution of IC IALLUIS is not affected by this bit.

If EL2 is implemented and enabled in the current Security state and either EL3 is not implemented or SCR_EL3.FGTEn == 1, execution of IC IALLUIS at EL1 using AArch64 is trapped to EL2 and reported with EC syndrome value 0x18, unless the instruction generates a higher priority exception.

ps.name: MRS
MSRregister
